chapter.title: Quick start
chapter.para: This quickly covers the standard steps for installing and deploying Kea. For further details, full customizations, and troubleshooting, see the respective chapters in the Kea guide.

section.title: Quick start guide for DHCPv4 and DHCPv6 services

listitem.simpara: Install required run-time and build dependencies. See for details.
Checkout the latest Kea revision from the Git repository: $ git clone git://git.kea.isc.org/kea

listitem.para: Go into the source and run configure: $ cd kea $ autoreconf --install $ ./configure [your extra parameters]
Install it as root (by default to prefix /usr/local/): $ make install
Edit your configuration file for DHCPv4. See doc/examples/kea4 for a set of examples.
Start Kea DHCPv4 server (as root): # b10-dhcp4 -c /path/to/your/kea4/config/file.json
Test it; for example, use the ISC DHCP client to send DHCPv4 queries to the server and verify that the client receives a configuration from the server: $ dhclient -4 eth0
Edit your configuration file for DHCPv6. See doc/examples/kea6 for a set of examples.
Start Kea DHCPv6 server (as root): # b10-dhcp6 -c /path/to/your/kea6/config/file.json
Test it; for example, use the ISC DHCP client to send DHCPv6 queries to the server and verify that the client receives a configuration from the server: $ dhclient -6 eth0
